0.Subtitle: ALMOST ONE-THIRD OF CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) IS ABSORBED BY THE WORLD’S OCEANS. THIS ACIDIFIES THE WATER THROUGH A CHEMICAL PROCESS CALLED OCEAN ACIDIFICATION

8.Subtitle: THESE CHEMICAL PROCESSES DECREASE OUR OCEANS’ PH - ITS LEVELS OF ACIDITY - WHICH HAS DEADLY CONSEQUENCES FOR MUCH OF MARINE LIFE

17.Subtitle:
SHELLS AND SKELETONS DISSOLVE, AND
MARINE ANIMALS’ PHYSIOLOGY CHANGES

21.Subtitle: THE ANIMALS ENCOUNTERED SO FAR FORM THE FOUNDATION OF THE MARINE FOOD WEB, AND REPRESENT THE FUTURE OF THE OCEANS

28.Subtitle: BUT DUE TO THE DRAMATIC CHANGES TAKING PLACE, THEY ARE ALSO THE ONES SUFFERING THE MOST
